CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Taking into account the fact that both IDT and NT are comparatively rigid coplanar structures along the polymer backbone , the IDT-NT based polymers may suffer solubility issue since the tetraoctylbenzene groups attached to the carbon bridges of IDT unit would not be enough to guarantee their solubility in common organic solvents. Therefore , the spacers consist of thiophene or bithiophene functionalized with various alkyl side chains were introduced in between IDT and NT units to improve the solubility of the resulting polymers , which may also potentially lead to improved molecular weight that is favorable for the optimal morphology and charge carrier transport. 39-41 We notice that the incorporated side chains may also increase the dihedral angle of their contiguous aromatic units , 42,43 which may somewhat inhibit polymer backbone planarity and thereby increase band gap and lower the charge carrier mobility. 40,41 However , it should be tried several different alkyl side chains to achieve a delicate balance of the molecular weight , solubility as well as planarity of polymers as no comprehensive rule has yet emerged of the influences of specific side chains. 44,45 It was realized that by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units , the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and film morphology can be optimized. Further investigation of photovoltaic performances indicates all devices present high V oc because of the relatively deep HOMO energy levels of these polymers , and the highest PCE of 5.05% was achieved based on PIDT-C12NT . Differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) and thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ; see Figure 1 ) were used to probe thermal properties. No phase transition was observed for all three polymers by DSC analysis up to 300 ° C. All polymers have decomposition temperature ( defined as the 5% weight - loss temperature , T d ) over 450 °C under nitrogen as determined by TGA analysis , indicating their excellent thermal stabilities. Optical and Electrochemical Properties. The UV - vis absorption spectra of all polymers in both chlorobenzene solution ( 1 × 10^-3 mg mL -1 ) and as thin films ( spin - casted from chlorobenzene solutions with concentration of 8 mg mL -1 ) are shown in Figure 2. All three polymers exhibit dual characteristic absorption bands , where the short wavelength absorbance originated from the π-π* transition of the IDT unit , while the long wavelength absorbance could be ascribed to the intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) between the IDT and the NT segments. 27 In chlorobenzene ( CB ) solution , PIDT - EHNT showed an absorption maximum at 599 nm and a slightly weaker peak at 433 nm ; when changing the branched 2ethylhexyl to linear hexyl side chain , the resulted polymer PIDT - DTNT showed a slightly bathochromic shift of two corresponding peaks to 608 and 439 nm , respectively , which may due to the reduced steric hindrance of the linear side chain.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| IDT |
| NT |
| PIDT-C12NT |
| PIDT-EHNT |
| PIDT-DTNT |

Note:

* IDT stands for "Indole-Diketopyrrolo-Thiophene"
* NT stands for "Naphthalenedione-Thiophene"
* PIDT-C12NT stands for "Poly(Indole-Diketopyrrolo-Thiophene-Co-Naphthalenedione-Thiophene)"
* PIDT-EHNT stands for "Poly(Indole-Diketopyrrolo-Thiophene-Co-2-Ethylhexyl-Naphthalenedione-Thiophene)"
* PIDT-DTNT stands for "Poly(Indole-Diketopyrrolo-Thiophene-Co-Dodecyl-Naphthalenedione-Thiophene)"

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PIDT-C12NT |
| PIDT-EHNT |
| PIDT-DTNT |

Note:

* PIDT-C12NT stands for "Poly(Indole-Diketopyrrolo-Thiophene-Co-Naphthalenedione-Thiophene)"
* PIDT-EHNT stands for "Poly(Indole-Diketopyrrolo-Thiophene-Co-2-Ethylhexyl-Naphthalenedione-Thiophene)"
* PIDT-DTNT stands for "Poly(Indole-Diketopyrrolo-Thiophene-Co-Dodecyl-Naphthalenedione-Thiophene)"

Therefore , the spacers consist of thiophene or bithiophene functionalized with various alkyl side chains were introduced in between IDT and NT units to improve the solubility of the resulting polymers , which may also potentially lead to improved molecular weight that is favorable for the optimal morphology and charge carrier transport. 39-41 We notice that the incorporated side chains may also increase the dihedral angle of their contiguous aromatic units , 42,43 which may somewhat inhibit polymer backbone planarity and thereby increase band gap and lower the charge carrier mobility. 40,41 However , it should be tried several different alkyl side chains to achieve a delicate balance of the molecular weight , solubility as well as planarity of polymers as no comprehensive rule has yet emerged of the influences of specific side chains. 44,45 It was realized that by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units , the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and film morphology can be optimized. Further investigation of photovoltaic performances indicates all devices present high V oc because of the relatively deep HOMO energy levels of these polymers , and the highest PCE of 5.05% was achieved based on PIDT-C12NT . Differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) and thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ; see Figure 1 ) were used to probe thermal properties. No phase transition was observed for all three polymers by DSC analysis up to 300 ° C. All polymers have decomposition temperature ( defined as the 5% weight - loss temperature , T d ) over 450 °C under nitrogen as determined by TGA analysis , indicating their excellent thermal stabilities. The UV - vis absorption spectra of all polymers in both chlorobenzene solution ( 1 × 10^-3 mg mL -1 ) and as thin films ( spin - casted from chlorobenzene solutions with concentration of 8 mg mL -1 ) are shown in Figure 2. All three polymers exhibit dual characteristic absorption bands , where the short wavelength absorbance originated from the π-π* transition of the IDT unit , while the long wavelength absorbance could be ascribed to the intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) between the IDT and the NT segments. 27 In chlorobenzene ( CB ) solution , PIDT - EHNT showed an absorption maximum at 599 nm and a slightly weaker peak at 433 nm ; when changing the branched 2ethylhexyl to linear hexyl side chain , the resulted polymer PIDT - DTNT showed a slightly bathochromic shift of two corresponding peaks to 608 and 439 nm , respectively , which may due to the reduced steric hindrance of the linear side chain.

| V oc |
| PCE |
| Thermal properties |

The remaining entities in the list are all specific property names of materials.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Taking into account the fact that both IDT and NT are comparatively rigid coplanar structures along the polymer backbone , the IDT-NT based polymers may suffer solubility issue since the tetraoctylbenzene groups attached to the carbon bridges of IDT unit would not be enough to guarantee their solubility in common organic solvents. Therefore , the spacers consist of thiophene or bithiophene functionalized with various alkyl side chains were introduced in between IDT and NT units to improve the solubility of the resulting polymers , which may also potentially lead to improved molecular weight that is favorable for the optimal morphology and charge carrier transport. 39-41 We notice that the incorporated side chains may also increase the dihedral angle of their contiguous aromatic units , 42,43 which may somewhat inhibit polymer backbone planarity and thereby increase band gap and lower the charge carrier mobility. 40,41 However , it should be tried several different alkyl side chains to achieve a delicate balance of the molecular weight , solubility as well as planarity of polymers as no comprehensive rule has yet emerged of the influences of specific side chains. 44,45 It was realized that by switching the spacer between the IDT and NT units , the processability , backbone planarity , charge carrier mobility and film morphology can be optimized. Further investigation of photovoltaic performances indicates all devices present high V oc because of the relatively deep HOMO energy levels of these polymers , and the highest PCE of 5.05% was achieved based on PIDT-C12NT . Differential scanning calorimetry ( DSC ) and thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ; see Figure 1 ) were used to probe thermal properties. No phase transition was observed for all three polymers by DSC analysis up to 300 ° C. All polymers have decomposition temperature ( defined as the 5% weight - loss temperature , T d ) over 450 °C under nitrogen as determined by TGA analysis , indicating their excellent thermal stabilities. Optical and Electrochemical Properties. The UV - vis absorption spectra of all polymers in both chlorobenzene solution ( 1 × 10^-3 mg mL -1 ) and as thin films ( spin - casted from chlorobenzene solutions with concentration of 8 mg mL -1 ) are shown in Figure 2. All three polymers exhibit dual characteristic absorption bands , where the short wavelength absorbance originated from the π-π* transition of the IDT unit , while the long wavelength absorbance could be ascribed to the intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) between the IDT and the NT segments. 27 In chlorobenzene ( CB ) solution , PIDT - EHNT showed an absorption maximum at 599 nm and a slightly weaker peak at 433 nm ; when changing the branched 2ethylhexyl to linear hexyl side chain , the resulted polymer PIDT - DTNT showed a slightly bathochromic shift of two corresponding peaks to 608 and 439 nm , respectively , which may due to the reduced steric hindrance of the linear side chain.

Let's think step by step.

1. First, let's identify the material properties mentioned in the paragraph:
* Solubility
* Molecular weight
* Planarity
* Charge carrier mobility
* Photovoltaic performances
* Thermal properties (including decomposition temperature and thermal stability)
* Optical properties (including UV-vis absorption spectra)
* Electrochemical properties
2. Next, let's extract the specific values mentioned for each property:
* Solubility: not explicitly mentioned, but the paragraph mentions that the incorporation of thiophene or bithiophene functionalized spacers improves the solubility of the resulting polymers.
* Molecular weight: not explicitly mentioned, but the paragraph mentions that the incorporated side chains may also increase the molecular weight of the polymers, which may potentially lead to improved charge carrier transport.
* Planarity: not explicitly mentioned, but the paragraph mentions that the incorporated side chains may also increase the dihedral angle of their contiguous aromatic units, which may somewhat inhibit polymer backbone planarity.
* Charge carrier mobility: not explicitly mentioned, but the paragraph mentions that the incorporated side chains may also increase the dihedral angle of their contiguous aromatic units, which may somewhat inhibit charge carrier mobility.
* Photovoltaic performances: the paragraph mentions that all devices present high Voc because of the relatively deep HOMO energy levels of these polymers, and the highest PCE of 5.05% was achieved based on PIDT-C12NT.
* Thermal properties: the paragraph mentions that all polymers have decomposition temperature (defined as the 5% weight-loss temperature, Td) over 450 °C under nitrogen as determined by TGA analysis, indicating their excellent thermal stabilities.
* Optical properties: the paragraph mentions that all polymers exhibit dual characteristic absorption bands, where the short wavelength absorbance originated from the π-π* transition of the IDT unit, while the long wavelength absorbance could be ascribed to the intramolecular charge transfer (ICT) between the IDT and the NT segments. The UV-vis absorption spectra of all polymers in both chlorobenzene solution and as thin films are shown in Figure 2.
* Electrochemical properties: not explicitly mentioned.
3. Finally, let's present the material properties and their values in a Markdown table:

| Property | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Solubility | Improved by incorporating thiophene or bithiophene functionalized spacers |
| Molecular weight | Potentially increased by incorporated side chains |
| Planarity | May be inhibited by incorporated side chains |
| Charge carrier mobility | May be inhibited by incorporated side chains |
| Photovoltaic performances | High Voc and highest PCE of 5.05% achieved with PIDT-C12NT |
| Thermal properties | Decomposition temperature (Td) over 450 °C under nitrogen |
| Optical properties | Dual characteristic absorption bands: π-π* transition of IDT unit and ICT between IDT and NT segments |
| Electrochemical properties | Not explicitly mentioned |

Note: The values for solubility, molecular weight, planarity, and charge carrier mobility are not explicitly mentioned in the paragraph, but the text suggests that the incorporation of thiophene or bithiophene functionalized spacers improves solubility, and the incorporated side chains may potentially increase molecular weight and inhibit planarity and charge carrier mobility.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 5.05% |
| 450 °C |
| π-π* transition of IDT unit |
| ICT between IDT and NT segments |

The following entities do not clearly refer to the value of a material property and were removed:

* Solubility (not a material property)
* Molecular weight (not explicitly mentioned)
* Planarity (not explicitly mentioned)
* Charge carrier mobility (not explicitly mentioned)

Note: The value of the material property "decomposition temperature" is given as 450 °C, which is the temperature at which the material decomposes. The value of the material property "optical properties" is given as "dual characteristic absorption bands: π-π* transition of IDT unit and ICT between IDT and NT segments", which describes the behavior of the material in terms of its optical properties.
